txt.en:
'You are alone, [placeholder]. You came to this tower with allies, but they have abandoned you.

'Your Rangers may find success in the woods, but in towers of stone they die the same as any others. They cannot save you.

'The Thandrim crossed me, long ago, and they are all dead. The only man who remembered them will have no vengeance. I gave him death instead, and none now will wield his sad sword or bear his broken shield.

'And Karazgar? Long have I thought to test my might against the Weeping Warrior, but he is a sneaking coward. When I have secured my position here, he will be the next to fall. But of this I am now convinced: he is no friend to you. Perhaps he and I will strike a bargain, for we each may have information of use to the other.

'[placeholder]! Do you dare test your will against Ugrukhôr, the Captain of the Pit? Did I say we were equal? I see now I was wrong! You are no equal of mine, for I am Gúrzyul... and I am your ending!'
Remain on guard
'Up here.'
'I hear wings. Don't like it.'
'Always hated those things.'
'Never trust anything that's got wings, that's what I say.'
'I don't see any sign of Karazgar. Maybe he's gone.'
'Or maybe he never came up here?'
'Is there any treasure up here, [placeholder]?'
'Now that looks pretty valuable....'
Remain on guard
Escort Lûrkh to the upper reaches of the tower, and ensure he survives
Remain on guard
Talk to Ugrukhôr
Remain on guard
Talk to Ugrukhôr
Talk to Lûrkh
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
With the advantage of surprise on your side, you should descend the tower of Barad Cúron and return to the throne room.
Culang has noticed your return, and now you must wait for his signal to attack. Do not let Ugrukhôr see you before that time!
The time has come to face Ugrukhôr, the Captain of the Pit, and avenge the lives he has taken.
Ugrukhôr, the Captain of the Pit, has captured the Ranger Annoth. He comes now to Barad Cúron to challenge Gothmog for supremacy of Imlad Morgul.
Talk to Culang inside the throne room of Barad Cúron
Ugrukhôr has asked you a question.
Gothmog has been defeated, but he is not the only Master of Mordor who has come to Barad Cúron.
Ugrukhôr does not have the capacity for mercy. He toys with you and with the lives of your friends.
Ugrukhôr has commanded one of his guards, an Orc named Lûrkh, to take you on a search of the tower for Karazgar.
'No!'
'Ugrukhôr dies today!'
'The Thandrim will be avenged!'
'[placeholder]... avenge... the Thandrim....'
'Be on your guard, my friend. We have few friends in this dark city, and fewer still who might gain access to this tower!'
Descend Barad Cúron and return to the throne room without alerting Ugrukhôr to your presence
Wait for Culang's signal to attack
Defeat Ugrukhôr, the Captain of the Pit
'You'd better come with me, slime! You're going to show me where your friend Karazgar is hiding, and if you so much as look at me strangely I'll kill you first!'

'Ah, now you speak swiftly. It is a good lesson, [placeholder].\n\n'But you will still not tell me if Karazgar remains in the tower? This defiance does not suit you, and it will avail you nothing. Indeed, it may cost you your life, or the lives of more friends. Is that what you want?'
'[placeholder]... I am all right...\n\n'I will survive... and Ugrukhôr will not!'
Lûrkh wants you to clear the room of merrevail while he studies the Oath-stone, pondering if some valuable piece of it might be chipped away and kept as treasure.
Lûrkh has given all his attention to the Oath-stone in the centre of the chamber. Now is your chance to overpower him!
Clear the room atop Barad Cúron of merrevail
Defeat Lûrkh, and do it quickly
Culang has noticed your return, and now you must wait for his signal to attack. Do not let Ugrukhôr see you before that time!
The death of Lûrkh will not go unpunished. You have failed
Ugrukhôr is ready to face you in single combat.
'Out of the way, prisoner!'
'Gothmog! Show yourself!'
'I have come for your life!'
'What happened here?'
'Quiet, prisoner.'
'My scouts saw Karazgar enter this tower.'
'Did he slay the Witch-king's favorite pet?'
'[placeholder]! I am asking you.'
'Speak or the Ranger dies.'
Instance: A Vengeful Heart
'Move it!'
'There might be more winged beasts around here.'
'Find out if there are any more lurking in this room, maggot!'
The Ranger Culang is in the throne room inside Barad Cúron.
'This stone must surely be worth something....'
'But how can I haul it away?'
DNT - Blah!
'Perhaps I can pry off a chunk of it?'
DNT - Blah!
'You had better do as I say, [placeholder].'
DNT - Blah!
'Is that really Gothmog?'
Ugrukhôr does not have the capacity for mercy. He toys with you and with the lives of your friends. He must pay for his cruelty.
'He looks dead to me. How about that?'
DNT - Blah!
Inspiration flows through your body, the last legacy of those betrayed by Ugrukhôr!
'Ugrukhôr!'
'At last you will know death!'
'Prepare yourself, [placeholder]!'
'What? It is a Ranger of Ithilien!'
'Annoth? Is that you?'
'You are too late, Ugrukhôr. Gothmog has been defeated!'
'Release Annoth and leave us, and no one else needs to die.'
'Curse you, Ugrukhôr!'
'Now, [placeholder]!'
Lûrkh has been swiftly defeated! Now you can descend the tower
'He dies anyway.'
Culang catches your eye. Be ready for his signal!
'Well, [placeholder]? Is Karazgar still in the tower?'
'Lûrkh! Take [placeholder] and search the tower!'
'If [placeholder] tries anything, give a shout and I will slay this other Ranger.'
'His blood will be on your hands, [placeholder].'
'So guard Lûrkh with your life.'
'What is this? Some relic prized by Gothmog?'
'Just dust? Bah!'
'So that is the way of it, then?'
'Come, [placeholder]. Can we not settle this as equals?'
Wait for Culang's signal to attack
'Prepare to join your friends in death, [placeholder]!'
Lûrkh is focused on the Oath-stone. Now is your chance to overpower him!
Talk to Ugrukhôr
'You have drawn blood, [placeholder].'
'For that you have my respect.'
'But know this.'
